intro: Pilosella coracodes, commonly known as the rock pilosella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Pilosella coracodes is a perennial herb that is often found in open, sunny environments.
